    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static Response get(String url,
                           List<Parameter> params)
                    throws HttpException
        Do a GET request on the provided URL and construct the Query String part with the provided list of parameters. If the URL already contains parameters (already contains a '?' character), then the parameters are added to the existing parameters. The parameters are converted into application/x-www-form-urlencoded. For example: field1=value1&field1=value2&field2=value3. The special characters are encoded. If there is a space, it is encoded into '%20'.
        Parameters:
        url - the base url
        params - the list of parameters to append to the query string
        Returns:
        the response
        Throws:
        HttpException - when the request has failed

      • get

        public static Response get(String url,
                           Parameter... params)
                    throws HttpException
        Do a GET request on the provided URL and construct the Query String part with the provided list of parameters. If the URL already contains parameters (already contains a '?' character), then the parameters are added to the existing parameters. The parameters are converted into application/x-www-form-urlencoded. For example: field1=value1&field1=value2&field2=value3. The special characters are encoded. If there is a space, it is encoded into '%20'.
        Parameters:
        url - the base url
        params - none, one or several parameters to append to the query string
        Returns:
        the response
        Throws:
        HttpException - when the request has failed

      • get

        public static Response get(String url,
                           Object... params)
                    throws HttpException

        Do a GET request on the provided URL and construct the Query String part with the provided list of parameters. If the URL already contains parameters (already contains a '?' character), then the parameters are added to the existing parameters. The parameters are converted into application/x-www-form-urlencoded. For example: field1=value1&field1=value2&field2=value3. The special characters are encoded. If there is a space, it is encoded into '%20'.

        The parameters can be anything:
        • Parameter: see get(String, Parameter...)
        • Map: each entry is used as a parameter (see get(String, Map)). The key of the entry is the name of the parameter, the value of the entry is the value of the parameter
        • A bean (any object): each property of the bean is used as parameter (see BeanUtils). The name of the property is the name of the parameter, the value of the property is the value of the parameter
        Parameters:
        url - the base url
        params - none, one or several parameters to append to the query string
        Returns:
        the response
        Throws:
        HttpException - when the request has failed

      • get

        public static Response get(String url,
                           Map<String,Object> params)
                    throws HttpException
        Do a GET request on the provided URL and construct the Query String part with the provided list of parameters. If the URL already contains parameters (already contains a '?' character), then the parameters are added to the existing parameters. The parameters are converted into application/x-www-form-urlencoded. For example: field1=value1&field1=value2&field2=value3. The special characters are encoded. If there is a space, it is encoded into '%20'.

        Each entry of the map is used as a parameter. The key of the entry is the name of the parameter, the value of the entry is the value of the parameter

        Parameters:
        url - the base url
        params - none, one or several parameters to append to the query string
        Returns:
        the response
        Throws:
        HttpException - when the request has failed
